text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with homemade chocolate fudge
you're not going to believe how easy it
is to make chocolate fudge we're using
the carnation evaporated milk recipe an
old American classic and you know what
in today's busy society who has time to
evaporate their own milk takes forever
carnation evaporated milk so much easier
so here we go we're going to take a
heavy-duty saucepan add one-and-a-half
cups regular white sugar 2 tablespoons
of butter or margarine but use butter
you notice the same calories right 2/3
of a cup of our carnation evaporated
milk quarter teaspoon of salt we're
going to put that on medium heat bring
it to a simmer give it a stir every once
a while make sure it's not you know
scorching on the bottom once that comes
to a simmer you're going to simmer that
for five minutes give it a stir every
once in a while and then turn it off to
that we're going to add a teaspoon of
vanilla extract a cup and a half of
semi-sweet chocolate morsels two cups of
mini marshmallows all right if you want
to add some walnuts or some pecans also
really nice I left mine plain because I
like playing fudge and you're just going
to simply stir that with the heat off
until everything melts it's going to
take a minute or two just keep stirring
just keep stirring i stir a lot of
things that's what I do and this is one
of the cooler things to stir because it
kind of looks all goopy and then it
turns into this beautiful chocolate
mixture I'm going to take an 8-inch
square pan 8 or 9 inch doesn't really
matter I lined it with plastic wrap some
people use foil I prefer the plastic
wrap we're going to pour in our molten
chocolate fudge mixture give it a few
tabs to settle it down let it cool at
room temperature for about 10 to 15
minutes just so it's not steaming and
I'm going to wrap it and put it in the
refrigerator until completely chilled
overnight is perfect at least a few
hours minimum it's got to firm up nicely
once it firms up you know what's coming
next you're going to cut it and eat it
so what I do is I just flip it over I
get a little silicone mat down on the
cutting board and the only thing here is
you don't want to cut it until it's
Yuli firm all right you can even throw
it in the freezer if you want so I'm
gonna unwrap that and I'm going to take
a nice sharp thin knife with a damp warm
paper towel because I'm going to wipe
each time I cut I'm going to wipe it
down so I get nice clean cuts and I'm
going to cut it by four and then by six
and I believe that's 24 pieces I mean
I'm no mathematician but that will give
you 24 pieces you can cut these as small
as you want of course the maximum number
you can get is one track I stopped
halfway cut in here to grab a piece
because I had to it was so just inviting
smooth creamy rich this is definitely
the easiest fudge recipe I've ever come
across like I said carnation evaporated
milk has been around forever this is a
time-tested recipe perfect for those
holiday dessert tables hey bring some
homemade fudge to your next gathering I
really hope you give this easy recipe a
try all the ingredients are on the site
and as always enjoy
